intro: Brachyscome tamworthensis, commonly known as the Tamworth daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in regions of New South Wales. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous small flowers arranged in a compact cluster. Brachyscome tamworthensis is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
